evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and observable during the early phase of the hist_pair_engine_t1 event on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew remains robust against alternative explanations or counter-evidence in the context of the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the incident, including timing, crew interactions, and operational context during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the historical pair engine T1 early phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is robust against alternative explanations or confounding factors, maintaining its validity within the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t1_early scenario.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in pushback operations, including timing, crew actions, and environmental conditions specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and observable during the early phase of the hist_pair_engine_t1 event on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25.

assumptions: The observed interactions imply communication attempts relevant to coordination.
The event timing corresponds to the early phase of hist_pair_engine_t1.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination with no observable breakdown during the early phase.
If mechanical or environmental factors fully explained the event without crew communication issues.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, but the aircraft overrunning the TRP and hitting the blast barrier indicates a breakdown in effective coordination during the early pushback phase, supporting the claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the communication was sufficient to prevent the event despite observed interactions

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the historical pair engine T1 early phase on 12-25.

assumptions: The ground markings (TRP) are assumed to be adequate and visible as no evidence suggests otherwise.
No mechanical or communication failures contributed to the deviation based on the provided evidence.
defeaters: If evidence showed that the pushback deviation was caused by environmental factors such as inadequate or unclear ground markings, or
If mechanical control failures or communication breakdowns were documented as causes instead.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation during pushback execution as the aircraft moved beyond the designated release point and hit a barrier, supporting the claim of procedural deviation in the specified aircraft and phase.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit evidence excludes environmental or mechanical causes, but the direct observation of procedural deviation is clear.

node.statement: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in pushback operations, including timing, crew actions, and environmental conditions specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase.

assumptions: The absence of reported equipment faults implies procedural deviation is the primary cause.
defeaters: If evidence of equipment fault traces or bench checks indicating control malfunction were found, this would favor mechanical control failure instead.

The instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows communication occurred between crew and operators, but does not confirm access to necessary communication protocols and procedures, thus neutral on availability claim.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs, communication device status, and physical location records to confirm presence and reachability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices and channels among crew were operational and available
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance logs, device functionality tests, and communication channel status reports during the event timeframe

children_spec.statement: Crew had timely access to necessary information to coordinate actions
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze communication transcripts, information flow records, and crew reports to verify information availability and timeliness

node.statement: Marking or signage information related to the incident location is unavailable or insufficient

defeaters: If evidence showed clear, adequate, and visible markings that were ignored or misinterpreted by the crew, this would favor procedural deviation instead.
If communication evidence indicated crew misunderstanding unrelated to markings, this would favor communication breakdown.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly references the presence and visibility of ground markings (TRP) and the aircraft moving beyond them, supporting the claim of marking or signage insufficiency.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the markings were truly insufficient or if procedural non-compliance occurred despite adequate markings

children_spec.statement: Pushback crew was available at the scheduled time
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew scheduling and attendance records to confirm if the pushback crew was present and ready at the scheduled time

children_spec.statement: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance logs and equipment status reports to verify if the pushback tractor and related equipment were functional and available

children_spec.statement: Communication systems between pushback crew and flight deck were available and functioning
children_spec.test_procedure: Review communication system logs and test results to determine if radios or other communication devices were operational during pushback

node.statement: Communication devices and channels among crew were operational and available

defeaters: If evidence showed failed or unavailable communication devices or channels among crew during the event.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1 and H3 directly indicate that communication devices and channels among crew were operational and available, contradicting the claim of communication breakdown.

node.statement: Relevant environmental data (e.g., weather, lighting) for the incident time is missing or incomplete

defeaters: If explicit evidence of missing or incomplete environmental data (e.g., weather reports, lighting conditions) at the incident time were provided, this would support the claim.
If markings or environmental conditions were documented as deficient or unclear, that would change the assessment.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history items mentions missing or incomplete environmental data such as weather or lighting conditions at the incident time.

node.statement: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use

assumptions: Pushback equipment was operational and ready for use as no evidence indicates equipment failure.
Ground markings were adequate and visible as no evidence suggests otherwise.
defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback equipment was malfunctioning or the ground markings were inadequate or not visible, this would change the assessment.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly shows the aircraft moved beyond the designated release point despite the pushback equipment being operational, indicating procedural deviation rather than environmental deficiency.

node.statement: Relevant sensor or monitoring data related to environmental or marking conditions is not accessible or missing

defeaters: If evidence showed missing or inaccessible sensor or monitoring data related to environmental or marking conditions, this would support the claim.
If explicit mention of environmental or marking data unavailability were found, the evaluation would change.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates that relevant sensor or monitoring data related to environmental or marking conditions is missing or inaccessible; history items describe crew actions and aircraft movement but do not mention sensor or monitoring data availability.
